alert.note: Alert for Chouteau; Hill (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 4:25PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Hill and northeastern Chouteau Counties through 500 PM MDT... At 425 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Big Sandy, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Big Sandy, Box Elder, Azure, Boneau, Sangrey and Laredo. This includes Highway 87 between mile markers 79 and 101. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for north central Montana.
